result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Brian Kohl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.  Maintain absolute sobriety, to be monitored by random urine screens.

Submit a DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge.  If not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Court ordered costs and surcharges waived due to the defendant's inability to pay.
-Restitution set at zero.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Brian Kohl

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Michael Brian Kohl not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel discussed matter further the the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Michael Brian Kohl not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense counsel requests a projected guilty plea date.  Case adjourned to Branch 24.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Brian Kohl in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Michael Brian Kohl in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed:  Discharge Summary
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with PICK N' SAVE, 250 W HOLT AVE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Brian Kohl in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Michael Brian Kohl in custody.  Gale G. Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
